title: Brookfield asks banks to help fund $2b Aveo bid
text:
Canadian giant Brookfield is in front of Australia's big four banks and offshore lenders seeking more than $1 billion to buy listed retirement play Aveo Group.

It is understood Brookfield pitched a $1.04 billion funding package to banks last week and is seeking commitments by November 18, which is about the same time its proposed Aveo acquisition is due to settle.

The debt's price, covenants, structure and the like was said to look much more like property-backed finance that would appeal to real estate debt teams, than the usual leveraged finance players.

Aveo chairman Seng Huang Lee, and chief executive Geoff Grady will be in front of investors at the scheme meeting on November 6. Peter Rae

The deal is expected to find its way to aged care funding teams inside the big banks, and is likely to be too sharply priced for credit funds. It's expected to fall towards big Australian, Japanese and European lenders.

Brookfield already has three banks on the hook to stump up the funds. ANZ Banking Group, Bank of China and Barclays Capital Asia are mandated lead arrangers and underwriters, but they and Brookfield would like to broaden the syndicate with up to a dozen other lenders.
description: Brookfield is in front of Australia's big four banks and offshore lenders seeking more than $1 billion to buy Aveo.
